subject: Creativity
title: The iPhone: Design That Killed Buttons
description: A short lesson to help you apply The iPhone: Design That Killed Buttons.

hook.text: In 2007, every phone had a keyboard. Apple removed ALL buttons except one. Industry experts called it suicide.

buildup.text: Steve Jobs insisted on a single home button and a full touchscreen. No stylus, no keyboard, no compromise.

discovery.text: The touch interface made the phone infinitely flexible â€” any app could redesign the entire screen.

twist.text: Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer laughed: '$500 for a phone? No chance.

climax.text: By removing complexity, Apple created a device so intuitive that toddlers and grandparents could use it without.

punchline.text: The bravest design decision wasn't what Apple added.

quiz.question: Why was removing the physical keyboard from the iPhone a design advantage?
options: The screen could be redesigned infinitely by any app
